### applyFixup() {#ac4f1ecc11d292a77e74ca1043c72c8d2}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void X86AsmBackend::applyFixup (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mcassembler">MCAssembler</a> &amp; Asm, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mcfixup">MCFixup</a> &amp; Fixup, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mcvalue">MCValue</a> &amp; Target, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mutablearrayref">MutableArrayRef</a>&lt; char &gt; Data, uint64&#95;t Value, bool IsResolved, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mcsubtargetinfo">MCSubtargetInfo</a> &#42; STI) const</>}
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
Apply the <code>Value</code> for given <code>Fixup</code> into the provided data fragment, at the offset specified by the fixup and following the fixup kind as appropriate.

Errors (such as an out of range fixup value) should be reported via <code>Ctx</code>. The <code>STI</code> is present only for fragments of type MCRelaxableFragment and MCDataFragment with hasInstructions() == true.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/x86/lib/target/x86/mctargetdesc/x86asmbackend-cpp/#l00178">178</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/x86/lib/target/x86/mctargetdesc/x86asmbackend-cpp">X86AsmBackend.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### determinePaddingPrefix() {#a9424257300fecd5e0b13d90e3532859a}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>uint8&#95;t X86AsmBackend::determinePaddingPrefix (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mcinst">MCInst</a> &amp; Inst) const</>}>
<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/x86">X86</a> can reduce the bytes of NOP by padding instructions with prefixes to get a better peformance in some cases.

Here, we determine which prefix is the most suitable.

If the instruction has a segment override prefix, use the existing one. If the target is 64-bit, use the CS. If the target is 32-bit,
<ul>
<li>If the instruction has a ESP/EBP base register, use SS.</li>
<li>Otherwise use DS.</li>
</ul>

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/x86/lib/target/x86/mctargetdesc/x86asmbackend-cpp/#l00131">131</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/x86/lib/target/x86/mctargetdesc/x86asmbackend-cpp">X86AsmBackend.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>
